question.title: What is the primary function of the facial nerve?
question.description: The facial nerve is responsible for controlling facial expressions, transmitting taste sensations from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue, and providing motor control to the muscles of facial expression.

option_a.title: Control of facial expressions
option_a.description: The facial nerve is primarily responsible for controlling facial expressions, including smiling, frowning, and raising the eyebrows.

option_b.title: Transmission of taste sensations
option_b.description: The facial nerve transmits taste sensations from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue, which is responsible for the sensation of sweet, sour, salty, and bitter tastes.

option_c.title: Motor control of facial muscles
option_c.description: The facial nerve provides motor control to the muscles of facial expression, including the orbicularis oculi, zygomaticus major, and orbicularis oculi muscles.

option_d.title: Regulation of salivation
option_d.description: The facial nerve is not primarily responsible for regulating salivation. This function is typically controlled by the glossopharyngeal nerve.

correct_option.title: Control of facial expressions
correct_option.description: The facial nerve is primarily responsible for controlling facial expressions, including smiling, frowning, and raising the eyebrows.
